name: ðŸš€ Sticker Shuttle Launch Board
desc: Complete launch plan for Sticker Shuttle with chronological tasks, priorities, and detailed prompts

cards.name: ðŸ“– Launch Guide Overview
cards.desc:
**Read First**: Complete launch guide with chronological phases, success metrics, and emergency procedures.

**Key Resources:**
- Launch Guide Document
- Emergency Contact List
- Risk Mitigation Strategies

**Success Criteria:**
- All team members familiar with their assigned phases
- Emergency procedures documented and accessible
- Weekly review meetings scheduled

cards.name: ðŸ”’ Fix CORS Configuration
cards.desc:
**CRITICAL SECURITY ISSUE** - Currently allows all origins

**Current Problem:**
```javascript
app.use(cors({
  origin: true, // Allows ALL origins - security risk
  credentials: true
}));
```

**Action Prompt:**
Update the CORS configuration in `api/index.js` to only allow requests from `https://stickershuttle.com` and `https://www.stickershuttle.com`. Test that the frontend can still make API calls after the change.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
- [ ] CORS restricted to production domains only
- [ ] Frontend API calls still work
- [ ] Unauthorized origins are blocked
- [ ] Test with browser dev tools

**Time Estimate:** 2 hours

cards.name: ðŸ›¡ï¸ Add Rate Limiting
cards.desc:
**CRITICAL** - No rate limiting makes API vulnerable to abuse

**Action Prompt:**
Install and configure `express-rate-limit` middleware. Set up rate limits for:
- GraphQL endpoint: 100 requests per 15 minutes per IP
- File upload endpoint: 10 uploads per hour per IP  
- Webhook endpoints: 1000 requests per hour per IP
Test with multiple rapid requests to ensure limits are enforced.

**Implementation Steps:**
- [ ] Install express-rate-limit package
- [ ] Configure different limits for different endpoints
- [ ] Test rate limiting with rapid requests
- [ ] Add appropriate error messages for rate-limited requests
- [ ] Document rate limits in API documentation

**Time Estimate:** 4 hours

cards.name: ðŸ” Add Security Headers
cards.desc:
**CRITICAL** - Missing security headers leave site vulnerable

**Action Prompt:**
Install and configure Helmet.js to add security headers. Enable:
- Content Security Policy (CSP)
- X-Frame-Options
- X-XSS-Protection
- Referrer Policy
Verify headers are present using browser dev tools or online security scanners.

**Implementation Checklist:**
- [ ] Install helmet package
- [ ] Configure CSP for your domains
- [ ] Enable X-Frame-Options: DENY
- [ ] Set up X-XSS-Protection
- [ ] Configure Referrer Policy
- [ ] Test headers with browser dev tools
- [ ] Run security scan to verify headers

**Time Estimate:** 2 hours

cards.name: ðŸ” Set Up Error Monitoring
cards.desc:
**CRITICAL** - Need visibility into production errors

**Action Prompt:**
Set up Sentry error monitoring for both frontend and backend. Configure:
- Error capture for unhandled exceptions
- Performance monitoring for slow queries
- Alert rules for payment failures and order processing errors
Test by triggering intentional errors and verifying alerts are received.

**Setup Tasks:**
- [ ] Create Sentry account and project
- [ ] Install Sentry SDK in frontend
- [ ] Install Sentry SDK in backend  
- [ ] Configure error capture
- [ ] Set up performance monitoring
- [ ] Create alert rules for critical errors
- [ ] Test error reporting
- [ ] Set up team notifications

**Time Estimate:** 3 hours

cards.name: ðŸ“Š Database Backup Configuration
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Ensure data protection and recovery procedures

**Action Prompt:**
Configure Supabase automatic backups (if not already enabled). Document:
- Backup frequency and retention policy
- Recovery procedures for different scenarios
- Test restoration process with a backup
Create a runbook for database disaster recovery.

**Tasks:**
- [ ] Verify Supabase backup settings
- [ ] Configure backup frequency (daily recommended)
- [ ] Set retention policy (30 days minimum)
- [ ] Document recovery procedures
- [ ] Test backup restoration process
- [ ] Create disaster recovery runbook
- [ ] Train team on recovery procedures

**Time Estimate:** 2 hours

cards.name: ðŸ§ª Critical Path Testing
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Test all critical user journeys before launch

**Action Prompt:**
Perform comprehensive end-to-end testing of critical user flows:
1. Product configuration â†’ Add to cart â†’ Checkout â†’ Payment â†’ Order confirmation
2. File upload â†’ Proof system â†’ Approval workflow
3. Order tracking and status updates
4. Admin order management workflow
Document any bugs found and fix before proceeding.

**Testing Checklist:**
- [ ] Complete checkout flow (guest and logged in)
- [ ] File upload and proof system
- [ ] Payment processing (success and failure cases)
- [ ] Order confirmation emails
- [ ] Admin order management
- [ ] Mobile device testing
- [ ] Cross-browser testing
- [ ] Document and fix all bugs found

**Time Estimate:** 6 hours

cards.name: ðŸ“ˆ Performance Monitoring Setup
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Set up comprehensive analytics and monitoring

**Action Prompt:**
Set up comprehensive performance monitoring:
- Configure PostHog for detailed user analytics
- Add Core Web Vitals tracking
- Set up conversion funnel tracking (visitor â†’ cart â†’ payment)
- Create dashboards for key business metrics
Test and verify data is being collected correctly.

**Implementation Tasks:**
- [ ] Configure PostHog events and funnels
- [ ] Set up Core Web Vitals tracking
- [ ] Create conversion funnel dashboards
- [ ] Add custom business metric tracking
- [ ] Set up real-time monitoring dashboards
- [ ] Test data collection across all flows
- [ ] Train team on dashboard usage

**Time Estimate:** 4 hours

cards.name: ðŸš¨ Business Alert System
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Get alerted to critical business issues

**Action Prompt:**
Create alert system for critical business events:
- Orders stuck in 'Building Proof' > 24 hours
- Payment failures > 5% in last hour
- Orders without tracking numbers > 48 hours after payment
- API error rate > 1% in last 15 minutes
Set up email/Slack notifications for alerts.

**Alert Configuration:**
- [ ] Set up order status monitoring
- [ ] Configure payment failure alerts
- [ ] Create shipping delay notifications
- [ ] Set up API error rate alerts
- [ ] Configure email/Slack notifications
- [ ] Test all alert conditions
- [ ] Document alert response procedures

**Time Estimate:** 3 hours

cards.name: ðŸŽ¯ Load Testing
cards.desc:
**MEDIUM PRIORITY** - Ensure system can handle expected traffic

**Action Prompt:**
Perform load testing on critical endpoints:
- GraphQL API under concurrent user load
- File upload system with multiple simultaneous uploads
- Stripe webhook processing under high volume
- Database query performance under load
Document results and optimize any bottlenecks found.

**Testing Scenarios:**
- [ ] GraphQL API with 100 concurrent users
- [ ] File upload with 10 simultaneous uploads
- [ ] Webhook processing under high volume
- [ ] Database performance under load
- [ ] Payment processing stress test
- [ ] Document performance baselines
- [ ] Optimize any bottlenecks found

**Time Estimate:** 4 hours

cards.name: ðŸ“ Legal Pages Review
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Ensure all legal documentation is current and accurate

**Action Prompt:**
Review and update all legal pages for accuracy:
- Privacy Policy: Ensure all data collection is documented
- Terms of Service: Update for current business model
- DMCA Policy: Verify contact information is current
- Return Policy: Match current business practices
Have legal counsel review if budget allows.

**Review Checklist:**
- [ ] Privacy Policy reflects current data practices
- [ ] Terms of Service match business model
- [ ] DMCA policy has current contact info
- [ ] Return policy matches current practices
- [ ] Cookie policy is compliant
- [ ] Legal counsel review (if possible)
- [ ] Update dates on all policies

**Time Estimate:** 3 hours

cards.name: ðŸ” SEO Optimization
cards.desc:
**MEDIUM PRIORITY** - Optimize for search engine visibility

**Action Prompt:**
Optimize SEO for launch:
- Verify all pages have proper meta titles and descriptions
- Submit XML sitemap to Google Search Console
- Set up Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
- Optimize product pages for target keywords
- Test structured data markup with Google's Rich Results Test

**SEO Tasks:**
- [ ] Audit all page meta titles and descriptions
- [ ] Generate and submit XML sitemap
- [ ] Set up Google Analytics 4
- [ ] Configure Google Tag Manager
- [ ] Optimize product page content
- [ ] Add structured data markup
- [ ] Test with Google Rich Results Test
- [ ] Set up Search Console monitoring

**Time Estimate:** 4 hours

cards.name: ðŸ“§ Email Template Testing
cards.desc:
**MEDIUM PRIORITY** - Ensure all automated emails work correctly

**Action Prompt:**
Test all automated email templates:
- Order confirmation emails
- Proof approval notifications
- Shipping confirmation emails
- Password reset emails
Verify they render correctly across major email clients and contain accurate information.

**Email Testing:**
- [ ] Order confirmation email content and styling
- [ ] Proof approval notification emails
- [ ] Shipping confirmation with tracking info
- [ ] Password reset functionality
- [ ] Test across Gmail, Outlook, Apple Mail
- [ ] Mobile email client testing
- [ ] Verify all dynamic content populates
- [ ] Check spam filter compatibility

**Time Estimate:** 2 hours

cards.name: ðŸŽ­ Staging Environment Testing
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Final comprehensive testing before launch

**Action Prompt:**
Conduct final testing in staging environment that mirrors production:
- Test with real Stripe test mode transactions
- Verify all webhooks are working correctly
- Test EasyPost shipping label generation
- Perform mobile device testing across iOS/Android
- Test admin functions thoroughly
Document any issues and resolve before launch.

**Final Testing Checklist:**
- [ ] End-to-end Stripe test transactions
- [ ] All webhook endpoints responding
- [ ] EasyPost shipping label creation
- [ ] iOS Safari and Android Chrome testing
- [ ] Admin order management workflows
- [ ] File upload and proof system
- [ ] Email notifications working
- [ ] Performance under simulated load
- [ ] All issues documented and resolved

**Time Estimate:** 8 hours

cards.name: ðŸ“‹ Launch Day Runbook
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Document exact launch procedures and contingencies

**Action Prompt:**
Create detailed launch day runbook including:
- Pre-launch checklist and verification steps
- Deployment sequence and rollback procedures
- Key metrics to monitor during launch
- Emergency contact information and escalation procedures
- Post-launch verification checklist
Review with entire team before launch day.

**Runbook Contents:**
- [ ] Pre-launch verification checklist
- [ ] Step-by-step deployment process
- [ ] Rollback procedures if issues arise
- [ ] Metrics to monitor during launch
- [ ] Emergency contact information
- [ ] Issue escalation procedures
- [ ] Post-launch verification steps
- [ ] Team review and approval

**Time Estimate:** 3 hours

cards.name: ðŸ”„ Backup Deployment Strategy
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Prepare for quick rollback if needed

**Action Prompt:**
Prepare backup deployment strategy:
- Ensure ability to quickly rollback to previous version
- Test database migration rollback procedures  
- Verify static asset CDN functionality
- Document emergency procedures for major issues
- Set up monitoring for deployment health

**Backup Strategy:**
- [ ] Test rollback to previous version
- [ ] Database rollback procedures tested
- [ ] CDN rollback capability verified
- [ ] Emergency procedure documentation
- [ ] Deployment health monitoring setup
- [ ] Quick rollback scripts prepared
- [ ] Team trained on rollback procedures

**Time Estimate:** 2 hours

cards.name: ðŸŽ¯ Limited Beta Launch
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Controlled launch to small user group

**Action Prompt:**
Execute limited beta launch:
- Launch to small group of trusted users/customers
- Monitor all systems closely for 48 hours
- Collect user feedback and track key metrics
- Be prepared to make quick fixes for critical issues
- Limit marketing/promotion during this phase

**Beta Launch Plan:**
- [ ] Select 10-20 trusted beta users
- [ ] Enable site for beta group only
- [ ] Monitor systems 24/7 for 48 hours
- [ ] Collect user feedback actively
- [ ] Track key conversion metrics
- [ ] Fix any critical issues immediately
- [ ] No marketing during beta phase
- [ ] Prepare for full launch based on results

**Time Estimate:** Ongoing monitoring

cards.name: ðŸ“Š Metrics Validation
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Validate all systems working correctly

**Action Prompt:**
Monitor key metrics during soft launch:
- Order completion rate
- Payment success rate
- API error rates and response times
- User conversion funnel performance
- Customer support ticket volume and types
Create daily reports for stakeholders.

**Daily Monitoring:**
- [ ] Order completion rate > 90%
- [ ] Payment success rate > 95%
- [ ] API error rate < 1%
- [ ] Conversion funnel performance
- [ ] Support ticket analysis
- [ ] Daily stakeholder reports
- [ ] Issue tracking and resolution

**Time Estimate:** 2 hours daily

cards.name: ðŸš€ Public Launch
cards.desc:
**HIGH PRIORITY** - Full public launch execution

**Action Prompt:**
Execute full public launch:
- Enable all marketing channels and campaigns
- Monitor system performance under increased load
- Have customer support team ready for increased volume
- Continue close monitoring for first 72 hours
- Be prepared for rapid scaling if needed

**Launch Day Execution:**
- [ ] Remove beta restrictions
- [ ] Enable all marketing campaigns
- [ ] Customer support team on standby
- [ ] System monitoring intensified
- [ ] Scaling resources ready
- [ ] Press release distribution
- [ ] Social media activation
- [ ] 72-hour intensive monitoring

**Time Estimate:** Ongoing

cards.name: ðŸ“£ Launch Communications
cards.desc:
**MEDIUM PRIORITY** - Announce launch across all channels

**Action Prompt:**
Execute launch communication plan:
- Social media announcements
- Email to existing customer base
- Press release to relevant industry publications
- Update website with launch messaging
- Monitor social media for feedback and respond promptly

**Communication Channels:**
- [ ] Social media posts (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook)
- [ ] Email campaign to existing customers
- [ ] Press release distribution
- [ ] Website banner and messaging
- [ ] Industry publication outreach
- [ ] Social media monitoring and response
- [ ] Customer feedback collection

**Time Estimate:** 4 hours

cards.name: ðŸ”§ Component Refactoring
cards.desc:
**MEDIUM PRIORITY** - Clean up technical debt after launch

**Action Prompt:**
Refactor the large admin orders component (`frontend/src/pages/admin/orders.tsx` - 3,484 lines):
- Break into smaller, focused components
- Extract order list logic into separate component
- Create reusable order detail component
- Implement proper component composition
- Add proper TypeScript interfaces

**Refactoring Tasks:**
- [ ] Analyze current component structure
- [ ] Plan component breakdown strategy
- [ ] Create OrderList component
- [ ] Create OrderDetail component
- [ ] Extract OrderFilters component
- [ ] Add proper TypeScript interfaces
- [ ] Test refactored components
- [ ] Update documentation

**Time Estimate:** 12 hours

cards.name: ðŸ§ª Test Coverage Implementation
cards.desc:
**MEDIUM PRIORITY** - Add comprehensive automated testing

**Action Prompt:**
Implement automated testing:
- Unit tests for critical business logic (pricing calculations)
- Integration tests for API endpoints
- E2E tests for checkout flow
- Set up CI/CD pipeline to run tests automatically
- Aim for 80% code coverage on critical paths

**Testing Implementation:**
- [ ] Set up Jest for unit testing
- [ ] Write pricing calculation tests
- [ ] Add API endpoint integration tests
- [ ] Create E2E checkout flow tests
- [ ] Configure CI/CD pipeline
- [ ] Set up code coverage reporting
- [ ] Achieve 80% coverage on critical paths
- [ ] Document testing procedures

**Time Estimate:** 16 hours

cards.name: ðŸ“ˆ Performance Optimization
cards.desc:
**LOW PRIORITY** - Optimize performance after stable launch

**Action Prompt:**
Implement performance optimizations:
- Add service worker for caching
- Optimize bundle size with code splitting
- Implement progressive image loading
- Add prefetching for critical resources
- Monitor and optimize Core Web Vitals scores

**Performance Improvements:**
- [ ] Implement service worker caching
- [ ] Set up code splitting for route-based loading
- [ ] Add progressive image loading
- [ ] Configure resource prefetching
- [ ] Monitor Core Web Vitals
- [ ] Optimize bundle size
- [ ] Add performance budgets
- [ ] Document performance gains

**Time Estimate:** 8 hours
